nodes.bodyText: I'd suggest maybe cleanup-searchable-snapshot in case we ever have a different snapshot task :)

I think leaving it as "cleanup-snapshot" makes sense as the step is agnostic of searchable snapshots. It issues a "delete snapshot" request for a particular repository and snapshot name (and in our use case we're using it to clean up the regular repository, not the searchable one)
Should we also catch RepositoryMissingException and re-throw a more helpful message? What do you think?
Sure
These need to be Objects.requireNonNull, currently it just returns true or false but doesn't throw an exception.
Good catch (I hadn't even acknowledged the existence of an API that just does obj != null - TIL :) )

Currently we do this as an AsyncActionStep, but should we rather do this as a ClusterStateActionStep to avoid having to actually issue the request and wait for it? I believe it would be a bit better then, and it would also allow us to copy settings that may not be settable (if we need that functionality in the future)
Oh interesting. I agree it'd be a better avenue
Why are we generating the snapshot name twice here?
Also, do we think {now/M} is enough granularity? We could probably go with /d to be a bit more granular?

Also, this should use the same validation that SnapshotLifecyclePolicy.validate() does for validating things (for example, no # in the name). We should factor that validation out into a method and use it here.
We can make SnapshotLifecyclePolicy.generateSnapshotName static and use that instead I think?
I moved that snapshot generation method here (this is that essentially) as the line of dependency we have is SLM depends on ILM and I didn't want to make it circular.
Javadocs?
Should we do some special processing for an exception due to a snapshot or restore already being in progress?
I thought we'd retry using our usual retry mechanism. Might be good to report we encountered this better though
I think this one may have been lost in some of the other reviews, but I still think it should be changed (to searchable-snapshot)
We might want to discuss what we want the prefix to be, I'm not sure about "ilm-restored-" in case we ever have a different (non-searchable) ILM action to restore a snapshot, what do you think?

Hm, I'm not sure I understand what you mean. The intention was to keep it "searchable snapshot" independent, which it is now. Do you have something specific in mind? (and this is also configurable in the RestoreSnapshotStep, in case we reuse it with regulard snapshot restores)
What about restored-? I think that fits a little more with our shrink- prefix
Can you add javadocs to this method?
And maybe this can be static? We could pass in the names of things, might make it easier to test?
Can you capture the snapshotState in this message also?
I think we could probably switch this to just "swap-aliases"
There's a comment above this about inheriting everything except for the writeIndex, but this looks like we're inheriting the write index setting?

Ah, yes, I'm planning to refactor this into one component and reuse it in ShrinkSetAliasStep. It's not clear to me why we wouldn't want to inherit the write index (as we're deleting the original index in this one update). Do you know why we're skipping it in the shrink case?
I don't think it's for a purposeful reason (at least I can't remember it being intentional)
If you want, in the future, you can use ActionListener.wrap(resp -> listener.onResponse(true), listener::onFailure) I believe, rather than a new anonymous class
We should check that the request was actually acknowledged and throw an exception if it wasn't so that it can be retried
I think a better name might be CreateSnapshotStep
I don't think we should expose this (meaning to hardcode it as false like you have), these are specific snapshots used only for searchable snapshots
We should probably check the status() of the response, it's possible it could be a failure in which case I think we could retry again immediately?
I think we could refactor the users of this class to use WaitForIndexColorStep and then we wouldn't need to add this class
Totally, thanks for the tip. I didn't know of its existence
Can you add a comment for future viewers for why this is not retryable? I already can't remember why it's not retryable :X

I was thinking since we're retrying using the AsyncRetryDuringSnapshotActionStep we might not want to make the steps retryable as well, but on second thought I think we should (as we would indeed want to retry on rest api call failures for eg). I'll swap this to true.
I believe this needs to configure the request to only snapshot this particular index, currently this is snapshotting all indices in the cluster
Great catch @dakrone, thank you

I think this name would be clearer if it were "delete_searchable_snapshot", right now I don't want administrators to thing this means all snapshots containing this index would be deleted. What do you think?
I agree. I didn't use this name before because it was sort of tied to the searchable repository, but that's not an issue anymore.
This should probably be at warn level

Should we at least warn/log if the response were not acknowledged? I am thinking since this is retryable we should no-op for an existing index that contains the mounted settings, and throw an error for unacknowledged responses so we retry in ~10 minutes.
I believe this should be snapshot_repository since we use underscores for our JSON parsing
I might be paranoid here, but can you add some logging to this method (and onResponse) at trace or debug level so we have some feedback in the event we need to debug this?
Can you add a comment about the use of nextStepKey here? I had to look at the code a couple of times to see why it should be null in some cases (now I understand, but a comment would be useful)

The grammar is a little weird:
snapshot [foo] for index [bar] as part of policy [baz] is cannot complete as it is in state [FAILED]

The "is cannot complete" needs the "is" taken out I think
This should include INCOMPATIBLE and PARTIAL, otherwise we'd spin forever in those cases
This should explicitly check for IN_PROGRESS, it might be easier to flip the if statement to only check for SUCCESS or IN_PROGRESS and do the onStopWaitingAndMoveToNextKey if there is any other state
This isn't a WaitForIndexColorStep.Info class, I think this needs to be changed to just Info
I think this should probably check the response and at least log/warn about an unacknowledged request?
This openIndexResponse should probably be aliasResponse since it's not opening an index

It was unclear where we wanted this to live, but I'm pretty sure that all the conversations I've heard have mentioned it being in the warm phase, @DaveCTurner was there ever a consensus on where it should go, warm/cold, or just cold?
I'm not sure, but can clusterState.custom(SnapshotsInProgress.TYPE) return null if there have never been any snapshots? Perhaps we should add a null check?
I'm starting to think we should add a GenericILMInfo class that is just a message field so we don't end up having to duplicate this class over and over in each step (not necessarily in this PR)
Could probably add assertTrue(complete) here
Can add assertTrue(complete) here as well (and a fail clause in the onFailure below)
We could probably put these somewhere else to start splitting this apart similar to #53488 (up to you of course)

Yes, totally, I am about to start doing that on master (and will backport here with the appropriate conflict fixes) as I think the scope of this PR is already quite large and some infrastructure needs to be extracted from TimeSeriesLifecycleActionsIT to be reused across the various new test classes.
Isn't this index going to be deleted by the policy (time value of 0 to delete), so we should probably just check that the index is missing and then make sure the snapshot still exists?
Should we check the acknowledgedResponse here and retry (throw an error) if the request wasn't acknowledged? I think we should
Super minor, but we can probably stick this before the targetIndexMetadata == null check to avoid an error where no settings are copied?
It might be worth having a separate discussion (I can't remember if we discussed it) with David & Co about whether we want the default for this to be true or false (can be had after this PR)
Super minor, but can you put an example name in the docs here like "for example, the snapshot will be named '2020-01-02-myindex-mypolicy-randomuuid'"?

I think this might be linking to the wrong thing, maybe

                 * {@link OnAsyncWaitBranchingStep} is a step whose next step is based on the {@link #asyncWaitAction} condition being met or not.

I actually think we need to return true here, it's possible that the snapshot was taken and completed (prior to the step being updated), and then the cluster was restarted, so the SnapshotsInProgress is null and won't ever exist because the snapshot was successful, best to err on the side of moving forward and doing a check than be wedged I think
Deleted the WaitForSnapshotInProgressStep altogether as we'll design a step that waits for a generation change in the repo metadata in a subsequent PR.

Super minor, but there's a typo here (and in the name of the file):
SearchableSnaposhotActionTests vs
SearchableSnapshotActionTests
The other "composed" action we have is set_priority so it would be inconsistent to use scores. If you don't have a strong opinion on this, I think I'd prefer we use underscores everywhere.
I read the other one as the step name rather than the action name, I agree that the action name should use underscores (like our other ones), sorry about that!
